from PyQt6.QtWidgets import QSpacerItem, QSizePolicy

from ColorReliefEditor.settings_widget import SettingsWidget
from ColorReliefEditor.tab_page import TabPage, get_instructions




[docs]
class PreferenceTab(TabPage):
    """
    Widget for editing preferences
    """

    def __init__(self, main, name):
        """
        Args:
            main (MainClass): Reference to the main application class.
            name (str): Name of the widget.
        """
        # Set up display format for the config settings that this tab uses
        # The config file is shared between all the tabs
        # @LAYER in keys is replaced by the current value of LAYER

        formats = {
            "expert": {
                "LABELS.3": ("CONFIGURE DOWNLOAD BUTTONS:", "label", None, 400),
                "DOWNLOAD.US": ("US Download", "line_edit", r'^(https?):\/\/.*\..+', 400),
                "DOWNLOAD.US_HIGH": ("US High Res", "line_edit", r'^(https?):\/\/.*\..+', 400),
                "DOWNLOAD.GLOBAL": ("Global Download", "line_edit", r'^(https?):\/\/.*\..+', 400),
                "LABELS.2": ("", "label", None, 400), "VIEWER": ("Viewer", "combo",
                                                                 ["QGIS", 'GIMP', 'Firefox',
                                                                  'Safari', 'GwenView',
                                                                  'ImageMagick'], 180),
                "LABELS.1": ("", "label", None, 400),
                "MODE": ("Mode", "combo", ["basic", 'expert'], 180),
                "INSTRUCTIONS": ("Instructions", "combo", ["show", 'hide'], 180),
            },

            "basic": {
                "MODE": ("Mode", "combo", ["basic", 'expert'], 180),
            }
        }

        # Create widget to display and edit settings
        mode = main.app_config["MODE"]
        self.settings_widget = SettingsWidget(main.app_config, formats, mode)

        # This tab uses app_config, not config for data
        super().__init__(main, name, on_save_callback=main.app_config.save, on_display_callback=self.settings_widget.display)

        # Put a spacer at the bottom to push items up
        spacer = QSpacerItem(
            20, 20, QSizePolicy.Policy.Minimum, QSizePolicy.Policy.Expanding
        )
        instructions = get_instructions(self.tab_name, mode)
        widgets = [self.settings_widget, spacer]
        self.create_page(widgets, None, instructions, self.tab_name)
